page.title: 10Farm animals, Tockwith
page.content: At{West Grange Farm, {Bilton-in-Ainsty,}Mr Pick keeps 80 steers and some poultry. The steers graze on pasture land in summer and in winter are kept in a large ventilated shed. Straw is spread on the floor. When they are cleaned out the manure is spread on the fields as fertiliser. In the winter the steers eat silage which is grass that has been cut and stored while wet and green. The silage is stored in large piles and wrapped in polythene. The concentrated juices of the grass seep from the silage and are collected in lagoons. This liquid must not enter the drains. The lagoon is emptied over the manure heap and so eventually finds its way back to the land.
